metadata.title: SwiftUI Font API and Typography Guidelines
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: Comprehensive documentation covering the SwiftUI Font API structure, system font text styles, custom font integration with Dynamic Type support, font modifiers for styling, and platform-specific typography specifications including tracking values and accessibility considerations.

sources.focus: SwiftUI Font struct API, methods, and properties
Typography best practices, Dynamic Type specifications, platform considerations

overview.description: An environment-dependent font. The system resolves a font's value at the time it uses the font in a given environment because Font is a late-binding token.

methods.declaration: static func system(size: CGFloat, weight: Font.Weight? = nil, design: Font.Design? = nil) -> Font
methods.description: Specifies a system font to use, along with the style, weight, and any design parameters you want applied to the text.

parameters.name: size

customFonts.description: Methods for creating custom fonts that integrate with Dynamic Type

methods.name: custom(_:size:)
methods.declaration: static func custom(_ name: String, size: CGFloat) -> Font
methods.description: Create a custom font with the given name and size that scales with the body text style.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The PostScript name of the font

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The base point size of the font

methods.dynamicTypeSupport: Scales relative to body text style

methods.name: custom(_:size:relativeTo:)
methods.declaration: static func custom(_ name: String, size: CGFloat, relativeTo textStyle: Font.TextStyle) -> Font
methods.description: Create a custom font with the given name and size that scales relative to the given textStyle.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The PostScript name of the font

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The base point size of the font

parameters.name: textStyle
parameters.description: The text style to scale relative to

methods.dynamicTypeSupport: Scales relative to specified text style

methods.name: custom(_:fixedSize:)
methods.declaration: static func custom(_ name: String, fixedSize: CGFloat) -> Font
methods.description: Create a custom font with the given name and a fixed size that does not scale with Dynamic Type.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The PostScript name of the font

parameters.name: fixedSize
parameters.description: The fixed point size that will not scale

methods.caution: Use sparingly; does not respect user accessibility preferences

methods.name: init(CTFont)
methods.description: Creates a custom font from a platform font instance.
methods.useCase: Advanced font customization using Core Text

steps: 1. Add font files (.ttf or .otf) to your Xcode project
2. Ensure font files are included in the app target
3. Add font filenames to Info.plist under 'Fonts provided by application' (UIAppFonts)
4. Use the font's PostScript name in Font.custom()
5. Test with Dynamic Type enabled to verify scaling
customFontIntegration.accessibilityRequirement: Custom fonts must implement Dynamic Type behaviors and respond to Bold Text accessibility feature

dynamicTypeSpecifications.description: Platform-specific Dynamic Type size specifications for text styles

large_default.note: Values scale proportionally between xSmall and accessibility sizes

specialFeatures: Uses bolder versions of Dynamic Type body and title styles
Introduces Extra Large Title 1 and Extra Large Title 2 for wide, editorial-style layouts
Supports vibrancy for hierarchy in text and symbols
textGuidance: In general, prefer 2D text - 3D text can be difficult to read
Maximize contrast between text and background
Consider making text bold when not on a background
Use billboarding to keep text facing the user

variants.name: SF Compact
variants.useCase: System font for watchOS, optimized for small displays

sanFrancisco.roundedUseCase: Coordinate text with soft or rounded UI elements, provide alternative typographic voice
features: Dynamic optical sizes - merge discrete optical sizes and weights into continuous design
System interpolates each glyph to produce structure precisely adapted to point size
SF Symbols use equivalent weights for precise matching with adjacent text

newYork.description: Designed to work well by itself and alongside SF fonts

variableFontFeatures.description: Variable font format combines different font styles in one file and supports interpolation between styles
variableFontFeatures.opticalSizing: Adjustment of typographic designs to fit different sizes
variableFontFeatures.dynamicOpticalSizes: System fonts support dynamic optical sizes that merge discrete optical sizes (Text, Display) and weights into continuous design
variableFontFeatures.note: Don't need discrete optical sizes unless working with design tools that don't support variable font features

widgetBestPractices.description: Typography best practices specific to widget development

fontRecommendations.reason: Automatic Dynamic Type support and platform-appropriate sizing

fontRecommendations.guideline: Prefer SF Compact Rounded for complications
fontRecommendations.reason: watchOS uses SF Compact Rounded in complications for consistency
Prevents layout shifts when displaying timers, counters, or updating numbers

fontRecommendations.guideline: Avoid fixed font sizes when possible
fontRecommendations.reason: Fixed sizes don't respect Dynamic Type preferences
fontRecommendations.alternative: Use .custom(name, size:, relativeTo:) for custom fonts

medium.notes: Balance between information density and readability

large.notes: More room for hierarchy; can use multiple text styles

accessibilityInWidgets: Widgets should respect Dynamic Type settings
Ensure minimum tap targets of 44pt even with larger text
Test with largest accessibility text sizes enabled
Consider layout adaptations for larger text (stacked vs inline)
performanceTips: System fonts are optimized and cached; prefer over custom fonts
Avoid complex font modifications in frequently updating widgets
Use semantic text styles for automatic optimization

legibility.guideline: Follow recommended default and minimum text sizes for each platform

legibility.reason: Ultralight, Thin, and Light weights can be difficult to see, especially when text is small

legibility.guideline: If using a custom font with thin weight, aim for larger than recommended sizes
Use typefaces designed for optimized legibility when needed

hierarchy.guideline: Use text styles to form typographic hierarchy expressing different levels of importance
Adjust font weight, size, and color to emphasize important information
Maintain relative hierarchy and visual distinction when users adjust text sizes

hierarchy.reason: Mixing too many typefaces obscures information hierarchy and hinders readability

hierarchy.guideline: Prioritize important content when responding to text-size changes
hierarchy.note: Not all content needs to scale equally

dynamicType.guideline: Consider using built-in text styles for Dynamic Type support
Make sure app layout adapts to all font sizes
dynamicType.testing: Turn on Larger Accessibility Text Sizes in Settings

dynamicType.guideline: Increase size of meaningful interface icons as font size increases
dynamicType.note: SF Symbols scale automatically with Dynamic Type

dynamicType.guideline: Keep text truncation to minimum as font size increases
Consider adjusting layout at large font sizes
Maintain consistent information hierarchy regardless of font size

customFonts.guideline: Ensure custom fonts are legible at various viewing distances and conditions
Follow recommended minimum font sizes for custom fonts
Implement accessibility features for custom fonts
Use .custom(_:size:relativeTo:) to scale custom fonts with Dynamic Type

leadingAdjustment.reason: Makes it easier to keep place while moving between lines

leadingAdjustment.scenario: Three or more lines of text
leadingAdjustment.reason: Readability concerns even in constrained areas

trackingValues.description: The system font dynamically adjusts tracking (letter-spacing) at every point size. These values are for interface mockups.
trackingValues.note: Not all apps express tracking values as 1/1000 em

watchOS.note: Different tracking values optimized for SF Compact

sfSymbolsIntegration.description: SF Symbols provides a comprehensive library of symbols that integrate seamlessly with the San Francisco system font
features: Automatically aligns with text in all weights and sizes
Precise weight matching between symbols and adjacent text
Scales automatically with Dynamic Type size changes
sfSymbolsIntegration.useCase: Convey concepts or depict objects, especially within text

emphasizedTextStyles.description: Display emphasized variants of system text styles using symbolic traits

emphasizedWeights.description: Emphasized weights can be medium, semibold, bold, or heavy depending on the base text style

customFonts.description: Custom font scaling relative to specific style
